Description: Ostracon made of a pottery sherd from the rim of an egyptian plate or bowl of about 20cm in diameter, wheel made, Nile clay with some chaff, mica and white lime bits. The vessel bears a red band around the rim at inside and outside. The outside shows three lines of hieratic script in black ink, parallel to the rim, the inside shows another line of hieratic but much fainter. Inside also white accretions.
